column4: hey guys im trying to figure out how to make a usb drive bootable with an iso in ubuntu but the iso is of a different os
if it's a windows iso then you probably gotta do it from a windows machine :/
cause you have to run bootsect from the cd's boot directory
from the windows console, bootsect /nt60 drive letter
that's how i did it yesterday....i've been trying to get a bootable windows 7 cd
well i have a macbook and i have refit (for booting purposes) and i have  a 2g usb drive and i need the wintendo to run a program that is not supported in linux
is wine able to use the windows command line?
so if i copy the iso to a xp machine i reformatt the usb to what format?
i dunno, alls i know is how i did it :/
it might work in fat32, but mine was done in ntfs
i ran bootsect from the cd's boot folder
basically you extract the iso and copy the contents to the flash drive
then once you do, bootsect that shiet homie. if you can use windows command line from wine, then just use wine to do it
